message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how one can reproduce the tower exactly as shown, using only the orientations provided in the “dictionary” image:

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET STRUCTURE
 • Total Blocks and Layers
   – There are 7 total blocks used.
   – They form three main “levels” (base arches, middle platform, and tower).

 • Spatial Arrangement
   – Base (Layer 1): Two identical red arch blocks, side by side, arches facing forward.  
   – Second Level (Layer 2): Two short green rectangular blocks sit directly on top of each red arch, with a long yellow rectangular block bridging across (resting on the green blocks).  
   – Top (Layer 3): One upright orange cylinder sits centered on the yellow block; an orange wedge (“roof” piece) caps the cylinder.

2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
Match each piece in color, shape, and rotation exactly as shown (no re‐orienting):
 • Red arch blocks (2 ×):  Dictionary #1 (same piece used twice).  
 • Green rectangular blocks (2 ×):  Dictionary #5 (same piece used twice).  
 • Long yellow rectangular block (1 ×):  Dictionary #8.  
 • Upright orange cylinder (1 ×):  Dictionary #10.  
 • Orange wedge (roof) (1 ×):  Dictionary #13.

Block Indices Needed:  
[1, 1, 5, 5, 8, 10, 13]

3)  PROPOSED ASSEMBLY SEQUENCE
Use these steps to place the blocks from bottom to top:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 1   // first red arch  
  Step2: Move block with index 1   // second red arch  
  Step3: Move block with index 5   // green block on left arch  
  Step4: Move block with index 5   // green block on right arch  
  Step5: Move block with index 8   // long yellow block bridging the two green blocks  
  Step6: Move block with index 10  // upright orange cylinder on top of the yellow  
  Step7: Move block with index 13  // orange wedge roof on top of the cylinder  
}

Following the above order with the listed blocks (exactly as they appear in the dictionary) will yield the same structure shown in the target image.
